items.content:
JavaScript Developer


Hiringthing


HiringThing is looking for an experienced javascript developer to focus on growing our cloud-based hiring platform.

You'll be responsible for building new frontend features with React/Redux, both independently and within a cross functional team. You'll also be responsible for maintaining and fixing bugs in existing features, some written in older frontend technologies (a mix of jQuery and Backbone).

You’ll enjoy working on the latest web technologies in our ever-evolving stack and have significant input into product direction, technology decisions and development priorities. We practice continuous integration and deploy on demand throughout the day.

Requirements


* Minimum 3 years of javascript experience

* At least one year of React and Redux

* Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/SCSS

* Familiarity with javascript testing

* Experience configuring webpack

* Independent work ethic or fully remote workspace experience

* Strong communication skills

* Experience with backend technologies (Rails specifically) a plus




Technologies in Play


* React w/ Redux

* Mocha w/ Chai

* Ruby on Rails

* MySQL

* Amazon Web Services

* Docker




Compensation/Benefits:


* 401(k) plan with Roth and Standard options

* $100/month telecom reimbursement

* Up to $50/month fitness reimbursement

* Ability to work remotely

* Comprehensive benefits offered to eligible employees

* Opportunity to contribute in a hands-on manner to the growth and direction of the Company

* Unlimited PTO policy

* Opportunity for professional development 

* 8 annual paid holidays for full-time employees




About HiringThing

HiringThing is a cloud-based software company that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants, and hire great employees. We’ve been in business since 2012 and are growing rapidly.

We’re a fully remote company with a virtual office. We're a technology-first team dedicated to building the greatest recruiting software available. We keep in touch with Slack and regular video conferences. We meet as a team daily and are required to connect with other teams during standard business hours. You can work from home, a coffee shop or the beach as long as the work gets done. 

We also offer competitive salaries, benefits, and an Unlimited PTO policy, in which each employee is afforded the flexibility to take vacation, take time off for illness and shift schedules as necessary.

Applicants will be asked to complete a brief assessment as part of the application process. This will take approximately 20 minutes and cannot be re-entered once you exit the process. Please allow enough time to complete the assessment. Thank you.

See more jobs at Hiringthing

items.title: Full Stack Engineer (Ruby on Rails) [On-site, remote, or 50/50]
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=34, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=24}
items.content:
This is a unique opportunity to become an influential member of a small engineering team located in Shepherd's Bush in West London. You will enjoy all of the benefits of working in a startup, the freedom to innovate, to explore new technologies and to use your experience and ideas to directly influence the business.

*---- Why ClickMechanic ----*

ClickMechanic is a marketplace for vehicle repairs. Our platform enables customers to acquire real-time industry-standard quotes for repairs (a first in Europe), services and diagnostics, and quickly book a vetted mechanic online. Our mission is to bring trust and transparency to car repair.

Founded in 2012, the company has grown quickly to offer nationwide coverage and is backed by such institutional investors as 500 Startups and Forward Partners, and angel investors including the former CEO of JustEat and Chairman of Treatwell.

Vehicle repair is a huge market, ripe for technology disruption. There are millions of consumers, tera- or even peta-bytes of potentially underused data, with an exceptional logistics infrastructure (parts distribution).

*---- The Role ----*

As a full-stack developer in a small team, you will work across all aspects of the product from architecture and DevOps to code reviews and tech support. Working alongside our CTO & Head of Engineering, you will deliver new features and continually improve our existing code.

Technology underpins our entire business. We’ve built an industry-leading quote engine and mobile Mechanic App. We consume millions of rows of third-party automotive data and have implemented machine learning to improve the accuracy of our quotes.

*---- Responsibilities ----*

* Writing well-tested production code in Ruby and JavaScript.
* Refactoring and rearchitecting legacy code where appropriate to ensure you always leave it better than you found it.
* Reviewing code fairly and honestly; and receiving code reviews openly on each of your pull requests.
* Collaboration with business stakeholders to develop requirements and expectations.
* Collaboration with technical stakeholders to discuss constraints and opportunities.
* Monitoring our production systems and providing technical support to the business.
* Maintaining our development pipeline and toolchain.
* Innovation and self-led learning.

*---- Our Technology ----*

As a startup, we prefer open-source technologies. Our main app is built with Ruby (on Rails) and is hosted on Heroku and AWS. We use both PostgreSQL and SQL Server relational databases and also MongoDB and Elasticsearch NoSQL databases.

Our mobile Mechanic App is built on JQuery mobile and we are planning to rearchitect this system onto a more modern framework (e.g. React) soon.

Our development pipeline utilises Jira, Git, GitHub, Docker, Webpack, Grunt and CircleCI.

*---- Requirements ----*

Your potential is much more important to us than a list of characteristics. Nevertheless, here is a list of characteristics that we hope already apply to you, or that you’re very keen to develop:
* You consider yourself fairly expert in at least one OO programming language (not necessarily Ruby).
* You have built a production web application using an MVC (or equivalent) framework (e.g. Ruby on Rails).
* The terms OOP, SOLID and TDD make you feel warm inside.
* You can write complicated SQL statements directly in the console without a query designer.
* Unix, Linux, Heroku, GitHub and NoSQL are not just made-up words to you.
* You can describe JavaScript as a functional, prototypal language and know what that means.
* You have strong Git-fu and can perform interactive rebases from the command line.
* You’re not afraid to get stuck into DevOps and have a go at, say, implementing Docker in a CI pipeline.
* You write your best code when pair-programming with another developer regardless of their experience.
* You wouldn't write a line of production code without writing a failing test first, because that’s how it’s done, right?
* You read about programming and technology because it’s a passion, not just a profession.
* You see legacy code as an exciting opportunity to innovate and make things better.

*---- Benefits ----*

* Working with leading open-source technologies in an agile team.
* A culture that embraces flexibility, and rewards growth and innovation.
* The opportunity to directly contribute to the success of the business every day.
* A competitive package including company pension and share options.
* MacBook Pro as standard.
* 10% innovation time.
* Manage your own training budget.
* Tea, coffee, fruit, snacks and Friday beers provided!
* Bringing trust and transparency to an industry which is widely recognised for high levels customer dissatisfaction.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=34, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=24}
items.content:
OfficeServe is a disruptor in the corporate catering market. Our products and services currently focus on food delivery services, but we have big plans to diversify and expand our offering in the b2b market.

We are a high growth, well-funded start-up business enabling our business customers to order food online through on-demand ordering. Our amazing head office is located at the heart of London’s Silicon Roundabout, 2mins walk from Old Street Station or 10mins walk from Shoreditch High street. The office includes a spacious lounge, roof garden, kitchen & dining areas, an on-site Cafe and gym (with regular fitness and yoga classes), bike storage, showers and screening room! The office also regularly hosts various technology meetups and events.

We have built our products using the latest technologies to create fast, scalable and accessible products that work on any device and deliver fantastic consumer experiences.

Our customer web portal is built using isomorphic React with a Node.js/KOA APIs on an AWS stack. We are looking for someone to take over and lead the front end (and associated back end elements) from our CTO as this area of the business now requires its own team.

The web portal is a key part of our offering and we expect this role to become more important within the business as we scale. There are plenty of opportunities to put your own stamp on the project.

REQUIREMENTS:

A minimum of two years working with Javascript preferably on AWS

Practical experience with:
- ES6, ReactJS or NodeJS
- BitBucket/Jira for issue tracking and code management
- Code testing in Javascript
- Npm, webpack, etc.

Useful to have:
- MySQL
- Amazon EC2 servers

We are looking for someone to start as soon as possible. The interview process will involve:

- A phone call with our CTO to discuss the company, your background and the role
- A face-to-face interview (at our Old St office) with our CTO and another member of senior management

This role is for an in-house position working at the Old St office (initially 5 days a week while you get familiar with our platform etc but later we are flexible to dropping this to 4 days in house and 1 day remote).

Now is an exciting time to join this entrepreneurial business with huge ambitions! Since launching in 2016, our business has been hugely successful in growing revenue and customer numbers. This growth has critically depended upon our people, high quality products and services. Most importantly, our success is and will be based on hiring exceptionally talented individuals that understand our customers’ value and need.

We look forward to hearing from you...

Please send a CV and we'll get back to you as soon as we can.

    Senior Javascript Engineer

    Arck Interactive is a growing software development agency combining the best of UX design, technology and security to help our clients build complex web and mobile products.

    What we are looking for:

    Arck is seeking experienced, full-stack Javascript engineers to create high-impact, consumer-facing applications and MVPs. You'll bring solid experience in emerging and traditional technologies such as: Vue.JS, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Karma/Mocha,Chai, JSON, Node.js, and Google Cloud infrastructure, to name a few.

    Most of the UI work we're doing these days is with Vue.JS, so we're ideally looking for a developer with extensive experience building Vue.JS components for complex web and mobile products.

    What you will be doing:

    - Work as part of a remote, distributed team developing applications and services using Agile development methods

    - Contribute to team and organizational improvements in process and infrastructure

    - Code, test and operate highly complex Vue.JS components

    - Implement customer-facing UIs for a wide variety of custom web and mobile applications

    - Collaborate with our client's product managers and engineering teams

    - Effectively use tools and ingenuity to identify and fix defects before they become a problem

    What you need to have:

    - At least 7 years of experience in software/web development

    - At least 3 - 5 years of experience with Vue.JS (or Angular/React) web frameworks

    - Experience with Yarn, Webpack, and custom Node script development for build tasks

    - Experience working with preprocessors like Less and Sass

    - Expert familiarity with SCSS

    - Experience writing thorough unit tests with Karma/Mocha/Chai

    - Experience with CI/CD tools such as CircleCI

    - Experience handling large-scale CSS applications and ongoing quality control to maintain parity across the product

    - Experience working with and optimizing SVG assets

    Nice to have:

    - Experience working for a software company

    - Experience with cross-browser, cross-platform, and/or interconnected systems

    - Familiarity with A/B testing tools

    - Backend systems like Java, JSP, and JSTL

    - Cloud (AWS, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Aurora, SQS)

    - Mobile Development (iOS, Android)

    You’re going to love:

    - Involvement and input into every phase of a project

    - Complex, challenging projects and incredible clients that inspire out of the box thinking

    - An accommodating, collaborative, and open environment in which culture and personality is valued and respected.

    Job Type:

    Full-time / Contractor / 1099 (30 - 40 hours / week)

    Requirements:

    Web/Software development: 7 years (Preferred)

    Angular, React, Vue, CSS, HTML: 5 years (Preferred)

    Education:

    Bachelor's (or commensurate work experience)

    Work authorization:

    United States (Required)

    Apply now!

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=4, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=28}
items.content:
Join a small JavaScript development team within a successful business about to embark on its next phase of growth.

* Lead and coach a small team of developers, whilst also contributing.
* Working on a varied 3 year roadmap for in-house products, including FLG (sales lead management) and Flow XO (chatbots and messaging).
* Our team is focused on JavaScript across the full stack.

**Who we are**

We're a B2B (SaaS) technology business established just over 10 years ago. Since then, our growth has been steady and organic, and we've built a great business with several £million in annual revenue and very healthy profits.

A few years ago we launched Flow XO, a business messaging and chatbots product. Flow XO is already a leader in its market with users all over the world.

**Our plan for growth**

We're now working on a 3 year plan to accelerate our growth and bring the FLG and Flow XO products closer together.

The foundations are there - strong history, good revenues, excellent profits, amazing people in both the team and customers.

Our plans include a new focus on sales and marketing, and a revamped approach to product, which will see FLG and Flow XO become an expanded product family and see new products brought into the mix.

**The role**

As the single lead developer and coach in the team, it will be your job to work alongside the product manager to turn product plans into well architected software products.

About half the time you'll be managing, coaching and organising the team. The rest of the time, you'll be working on code alongside the rest of the team.

You'll be working on both the front-end (React/Redux and Angular) and also the back-end (Node, MongoDB & Redis) plus anything else we bring into the picture for our new products. The work is challenging, as we're building complex products with interesting problems around UX, scaling, and architecture.

Although there's obviously some complexity in the codebase, we've worked hard to reduce technical debt, achieve excellent test coverage, and follow conventions where possible. So you'll be joining projects where most of the working day is spent thinking about the future rather than catching up with the past.

Our product roadmap means there is likely to be whole new products being actively worked on every 3-6 months, at least for the next few years.

**Is this you?**

* You have a few years' experience of building full-stack JavaScript web apps
* You currently have team leadership responsibilities and want to develop that further. We need you to lead technical discussion to collaborate with the team and nurture innovation whilst always having an eye on the commercial strategy. We also need you to act as our scrum master (or delegate the responsibility elsewhere)
* You want to coach and develop other members of the team around you
* You're engaging, approachable and pragmatic
* You're a great communicator
* Always be considering 'what if', so you can write code and design logic that is robust and secure

If this is you, please come and join our team. Our customers need you.

**The rewards**

This is a rare opportunity to transform something great into something incredible.

A chance to plot the businesses growth and point proudly to when you joined the business, just before the curve takes that sharp upwards turn.

As well as a rewarding challenge, we also offer:

* A very competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Part-time remote working available
* Our product team is based in Manchester City Centre in a cool office. We don't care about your gender, race, sexuality, age, whether you have disabilities we need to accommodate, etc. - we're simply looking for someone that can deliver.

**Next steps**

The first step is to send us your current CV and write us an intro.

The intro is important, you need to explain (succinctly) how you fit into the picture.

We're looking forward to hearing from you. Don't delay.

items.title: Developers - Junior to Senior
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=11, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=6, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=21}
items.content:
Amplify Life is a personal challenge and coaching hub, recently available on the App Store and Google Play.
We are looking for senior and junior developers to join our dynamic team based in a unique location on the outskirts of Horsham. With stunning countryside views, a team who are full of life and a quickly evolving brand, Amplify Life is truly an exceptional place to work.

Our ideal candidate will have experience of some or all of the following technologies (depending on seniority and experience):

Back end developers (Java, predominantly) with experience of:
• Server-side Java 8+ exposing RESTful web services using SpringBoot
• MYSQL or similar RDBMS

Front end developers:
• AngularJS, ideally with Ionic / Cordova
• HTML / CSS / Javascript / Typescript

Full-stack developers with a combination of the above would be especially useful to us.

You should be comfortable working in a team environment, and be familiar with:
• Test Driven Development
• Agile methodology
• GitHub, Jenkins
• Cloud based application delivery (e.g. AWS or similar)
• Developing applications for mobile apps

You may be a full stack developer (or aspire to become full stack), or may have decent to strong expertise in either front-end app development with AngularJS / Ionic or similar, or in developing robust enterprise-scale Java based Web-services in the cloud.

Right now, we need solid (and indeed, SOLID!) hands-on coders, but as the company grows, there is the opportunity to leads teams in any number of exciting areas. We also have global ambitions, so if you are interested in travel, and possibly working in Australia, America, etc. this could certainly happen.

We are looking for great developers who are passionate about some or all of the following:
• Mobile development
• AI, Big Data & Machine Learning
• Wearable technology
• AWS / Cloud
• Continuous delivery / deployment

We currently need developers right across the board, so whether you are a seasoned developer with many years of experience or a more junior, but enthusiastic developer who is keen to learn, or anywhere in between, we want to hear from you.

Any applicants should have a keen interest in health, sports or fitness as this will be beneficial in shaping the product, and indeed testing it.

Amplify can offer a competitive salary and benefits as well as 25 days holiday (excluding bank holidays). Our offices offer a stunning and peaceful setting to work in, a fully stocked soft drinks fridge, BBQ facilities, sun terrace, table tennis table, football and badminton facilities and a woodland adventure trail.
Due to remote location access to a car is a must!

items.content:
Lead Developer

Company: Back Market
Location: Paris, France
Job type: Full-time
Salary: EUR 60000-80000
Skills:
  • Agile
  • Algolia
  • AWS
  • Celery
  • Django
  • Docker
  • ElasticSearch
  • Jenkins
  • New Relic
  • Nginx
  • Python
  • REST API
  • SEO
  • SQS
  • unit testing
  • VueJS

    • Job description

    ABOUT US

    Working at Back Market is an everyday mission, challenging and exciting. We’re looking for smart people who can help us create new solutions to develop ourselves.

    We truly think that the world needs more companies like us; we’re not only trying to show the world that other ways of consumption are possible but we’re also fighting against planned obsolescence by giving second life to electronics and reducing waste. We dare to create and follow our dreams, building solutions to make one of the greenest marketplace to rise up.

    We’re growing up amazingly fast, and we want to keep it that way. As a member of the BOT, you’ll be in charge of building the best experience possible for our customers and merchants. You will build the growth by coding, reviewing, learning and sharing your knowledge with others. We have ambition, that’s why a big part of your job will be helping us setting up new processes to reach our goals quicker.

    Human qualities are, for us, as much important as computer skills and the right people should fit with our values : #LOVE / #JAJAJA /#MARS / #REAL / #RESPHUMBLE / #SWEAT

    WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING...

    Within the BOT and our european team located between Paris and Bordeaux, you’ll have to implement new features regarding the business and technical roadmaps of your feature team.

    “Did you say feature team ??” YEESSSSS WE DID

    We’re actually revamping our organization into feature team (or squad, or product team : we’re still looking for our own terms. As you can see, it’s the very beginning of our story and there is everything to build. Awesome right ? )

    But let’s back to you, depending to your experience and what you’re looking for, you’ll have the opportunity to join one of this following team :

    • Offer : You’ll be in charge to handle every subjects related to the products we sell. On back side, the entire administration of the products. On front side, the presentation of this products, the way they’re organized, etc.
    • Payment : You will manage the entire life cycle of an order. You’ll define and optimize the payment strategy, the conversion, the fraud protection, the purchase options (insurances, delivery mode, etc). If you have already worked with Adyen and/or Stripe, that would be great.
    • User’s Data : Here you’ll have to handle every informations related to our clients (merchants and customers). On front and back sides, you’ll be in charge of the onboarding and of the client’s lifecycle.
    • Customer’s Satisfaction : You’ll have to manage everything that happens after a purchase. You’ll be in charge of the interfaces for the customer care and of every tools that allow our client to speak with us.
    • Love & Storytelling : Here will be done every subjects related to the corporate identity and its content. Especially on front, you’ll manage every subjects from the brand team and you’ll guarantee the declination of the Back Market ton in features.

    Of course, this organization is not set in stone. As our team features, it is in continuous evolution and improvement.

    THIS JOB IS FOR YOU AND YOU’RE IN THE PLACE TO BE IF…

    • You’re an accomplished engineer with at least 2 years experience as a lead developer.
    • You’re self-initiated, fast learner with a positive attitude : we don’t want to tell you what to do all the time - hopefully you will tell us what we need to be doing
    • You have the capacity to identify priorities and a great business sense
    • You have a strong sense of team spirit thriving in a fast paced environment
    • You have an excellent attention to detail, quality of work and time management
    • You love to mentor developers, pass on your knowledge, raise awareness to good practices and make sense of what they do.
    • You want to join a challenging technical environment and you’re comfortable with our stacks: AWS, RestFul API, Python, Django, VueJs, Algolia, NewRelic, Jenkins, Docker, Intégration en continue, Agile, SEO, Celery, SQS, ElasticSearch, Nginx, UWSGI, Unit Test

    WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US ?

    • Daily technical challenges : with us, you will forget what the word boring means !
    • A band of experts who will offer you their technical know-how and will allow you to build skills in your prefered technologies but not only ! (Backacademy, technical guilds)
    • A feature team to build from scratch and a passionate dev team to drive.
    • A job that makes sense : you’ll tell people to buy products that have already lived instead of buying new ones. Which means reducing the production of electronic waste and fight against overproduction. It counts.
    • A high growth project : 3 years ago, we were 3. now we are more than 90 and we are lived in 6 different countries. Boom.
    • Lots of groove : you will have many opportunities to work with talented and super friendly people.
    • Attractive compensation, based on the profile and experience

    Let’s have a quick talk ?

    Apply now!

ReactJS Front End Developer

Location: Remote Earth
Role and job type: Engineering Contractor

Job Description

The Chintai project is looking for an experienced ReactJS front end developer to help us convert our UI comps from Sketch/Photoshop to React components. The UI is for a token leasing interface dApp and has already been worked out, just need someone to come in and code it, document it, etc…

The ideal candidate would be english speaking with good technical writing skills and communication with the ability to create and document reusable React components. It is very important to the project that the code is maintainable, as it is open source.

Applicants should be self starters and have the ability to keep up with regular meetings and report their hours for the community, as this will be a high profile project in the EOS ecosystem.

items.content:
Experienced Front End Developer, Blockchain | JavaScript

Company: Ape Unit
Location: Berlin, Germany
Job type: Full-time
Salary: EUR 40-70

Company description

We are a tech hub - a multidisciplinary and inclusive network or creators, strategists, developers and designers in Berlin. Our work is filled with curiosity. We like to identify opportunities: working side by side with disruptive blockchain innovators, established owner-managed companies and global corporations. Our mission is to coordinate, create and accelerate change for an exclusive circle of clients, cultivating long term relationships and always aiming for excellence.



We are a design focused development firm and our reputation is built on our hands-on approach. We keep our promises to each other, our partners, clients and users. We offer our employees a positive working environment that runs like a business but acts like a family. We are supportive and agile, we offer curious and enthusiastic individuals the time and space to research and evaluate trends and technologies in open source software and grow their skill sets. Our structure allows for flexible working hours, new working models, realistic workloads with high value on not treating people like robots, because we respect your personal time! Being part of a diverse team of professionals in a comfortable, friendly office where you are fairly compensated for your efforts offers a high standard of living in beautiful Berlin.

Job description

We are creating a blockchain ecosystem through the development of interfaces, lighthouse apps and developer resources. Our ultimate goal is to help this technology to reach its full potential by making it more accessible and useful to everyone.

We are currently seeking a Berlin based, experienced Front End developer with good communication skills to join our growing team as soon as possible. Blockchain experience is required. You are going to help conceptualize, coordinate and develop different kinds of decentralized blockchain applications, BC connected backend systems and websites. You will be the bridge between the design and technical development, a highly valued member of our team who will have the opportunity to take ownership of specific aspects of our primary blockchain project.

Your Profile

Our ideal candidate is an experienced front end developer, collaborative, self-motivated, and a fast and dedicated learner who is interested in new challenges. You can push ideas forward in an agile project environment, are comfortable working with a diverse, partly remote team and are able to see the big picture in any project as well as lead your team to clarity with a solution oriented approach. You are a bridge between the technical and visual aspects of the project, and always excited about new possibilities. Oh, and you are a great software developer!

Skills

· Excellent skills in modern JavaScript, NPM, Node.js

· Proficient in GIT and knowledge of pull request based workflows

· Interest and experienced in API design

· General understanding of Blockchain and decentralized apps and motivated to learn more

· Skilled in one of the following (or similar): Vue.js (prefered), React, Angular

· Experience in frontend bundling (Webpack) and testing

· basic CSS skills and the ability to create simple layouts

· Excellent communication skills

· Team management experience

Bonus Skills

· Some experience with Linux servers, NGINX and cloud hosting (AWS, DO)

· Experienced in smart contract programming (Solidity)

· Understanding of cryptography

· Good CSS3 + SCSS

We Offer

· The time and space to research and evaluate trends and technologies in open source software and grow your skill set

· Flexible working hours, new working models, realistic workloads with high value on not treating people like robots, we respect your personal time!

· Being part of a diverse team of professionals in a comfortable, friendly office

· Competitive salary that offers a high standard of living in beautiful Berlin

*Because of our timely needs, we are looking for someone who currently lives in or is planning to rapidly relocate to Berlin on their own. No relocation assistance will be offered for this position.

Impact

· The chance to actively influence and contribute to a cutting edge technology

· Join an exciting project with huge potential, moving blockchain technology forward

· Work on a mass market approach towards the possibilities of blockchain and deliver real-world impact

As a valued member of the Unit you will receive competitive hourly compensation, free fruit, drinks and team lunch daily. Also four weeks paid holiday and a pony!

Apply now!

items.title: Data Analyst & Dashboard Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=24, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
*SOLVING THE PROBLEM OF FOOD WASTE*

OLIO is the world’s only neighbour-to-neighbour food sharing app, and our mission is to solve the problem of food waste in the home & local community. We do this by connecting anyone with spare food – which can be households or local businesses – with neighbours living nearby who would like it. Globally, over one third of all the food we produce gets thrown away, which is worth over $1 trillion. What few people realise however is that in the developed world, over half of all food waste takes place in the home, with the average UK family throwing away £800 of food each year - collectively adding up to £15bn. OLIO solves this with our award-winning mobile & web apps. Over the past 2 years OLIO has grown from a local initiative in North London to a global movement.

We now have over 465,000 users who have together shared well over half a million portions of food – with food being successfully shared in 32 countries and counting. Underpinning this incredible growth has been our volunteer programme, with over 19,000 people reaching out to spread the word about OLIO in their local community and rescue unsold food.

OLIO is now looking to grow our core team as we embark upon the next exciting phase in our journey.

*JOIN OUR TEAM!*

In order to accelerate OLIO to its next level in growth and impact, we are recruiting for a Data Analyst & Dashboard Developer, who will report into Viv Taylor, Product Manager.

In this role you will be responsible for:

* Data Analysis: Analysing key business questions in our burgeoning data via an SQL interface (both through
GUI and command line tools)
* Data Visualization: Development of a “data dashboard” for the company to help us interrogate our data
visually and in a user friendly manner
* Data Innovation: Liaison with our broader OLIO team to ensure that the right questions are being asked of
our growing datasets, in the right order.
* Data Exploration: Evaluation of the effects of specific initiatives/experiments at OLIO, generating and
presenting reports of their efficacy
* Setup of regular reports that provide insight into ongoing company/departmental performance.
* Assisting with online ad creative endeavours, their implementation and analysing their impact

Once you have proven yourself you will have great freedom and autonomy, coupled with an enormous opportunity for personal development. All of our roles are remote working roles, however for London based team members
there is the ability to co-work as well. We live for our mission, but like to have fun along the way!

*IS THIS YOU?*

Our ideal candidate will first and foremost be as passionate about our mission as we are! In addition to this, you will have the following experience and skills:

* Significant prior experience with SQL and RDBMS.
* Experience with Web Development and Visualization Tools, preferably with experience of relevant
JavaScript libraries (such as D3, jQuery, Bootstrap) and knowledge web models (e.g. LAMP)
* Experience of image processing software (e.g. Photoshop/GIMP)
* Excitement about Productivity Tools and Data Science.
* Curiosity about and enthusiasm for systems and processes
* Scrappy and resourceful when facing challenges of all types
* An eye for detail

*Bonus points:*

* You have experience working for a high-growth startup
And all OLIO team members share these attributes:
* A self-starter with a ‘can-do’ attitude
* Resourceful and creative
* Thorough, but able to move quickly and decisively
* A ruthless ability to prioritise
* Excellent communication skills
* Fun to work with :)

items.content:
Location: Old Street, London N1
Start Date: ASAP
Salary: £40K-£55K depending on experience and skill level

WHO ARE DRIFTROCK?

Driftrock aims to make advertising through social channels better. There’s no excuse for being chased around the internet by images of products you’ve already bought. It’s irritating for the end user and counterproductive for the company attempting to sell their products or services. Using our tooling marketers can refine their targeting such that the ads are only shown to people who have shown genuine interest.

WORKING AT DRIFTROCK

Driftrock’s tooling provides our users with a way to receive, transform, track and optimise leads from social channels. Currently these tools look and feel very separate so we’re in the process of bringing them together, with the view to having Driftrock be more of a platform than a set of tools. Other problems we’re solving, and are looking to solve in the near future, include:
. How to securely and safely handle personally identifying information;
. How to enrich incoming data with information that will help our users decide on the best next steps for their leads;
. What reports to provide to our users such that they can see if their efforts are resulting in quality leads and what they can do to improve.

The technology is a mixture of Ruby, Elixir and React applications hosted on Kubernetes and Google Cloud. We make use of Redis and Postgres for data storage and RabbitMQ for event processing.

You will be expected to:
. Build RESTful APIs, event-based systems and front-end applications;
. Work with well-known public APIs like Facebook and LinkedIn;
. Design and improve user experience;
. Support production systems;
. Manage cloud infrastructure.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We’re a small team of 15 people at Driftrock but we’re growing. Our product development team is 7 people with 6 developers and 1 CTO, this means that anyone we bring in can have a huge impact on the culture and practices of the team.

We believe in continuous improvement and we are constantly refining and improving how we work and communicate. One of the ways we do this is by performing fortnightly retrospectives, which are often run by different team members.

Currently we make use of daily standups and weekly prioritisation meetings to ensure we're pulling in the same direction and maintaining our focus of delivering value to our end users early and often.

ABOUT YOU

. You should be keen to learn and improve technical, product and personal skills;
. You want to be involved in crafting products whilst building on the culture and process of the product team;
. You are happy working in a small team, collaborating closely with other engineers as well as our product and sales teams;
. You can provide new and diverse viewpoints for our technical and product discussions;
. You are interested in agile practices such as continuous delivery, TDD, pair programming, code reviews and retrospectives;
. You are keen to ensure there is a high standard of quality and security in the software we produce as a team;
. You have had some exposure to Ruby, Elixir or Javascript (we do not expect you to have experience in all of those languages);
. You have the right to work in the UK.

WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?

The interview process has some flexibility but is primarily made up of the following stages:

. An initial phone conversation with an engineer;
. A take home technical test/coding challenge;
. Followed by an on-site pairing interview, where we'll build on your code challenge solution. We then do an informal problem solving task and we finish up with an informal chat with the rest of the team;

We try our hardest to reduce the amount of stress involved in the process, we’re not trying to catch you out with trick questions and if at any point (even on the take home test) you have any questions for us we encourage you to ask them.

BENEFITS

. You will work with passionate and smart people, in an environment where we firmly believe in sharing knowledge;
. You will be an integral part of a growing and innovative tech startup;
. You can be enrolled to the Company’s pension scheme;
. The company atmosphere is social and friendly;
. You will be part of fun monthly team events.


We will not be considering any recruitment agencies for this role.

"By applying for this job you hereby give us permission to store your data on our secure applicant tracking system and to contact you with regards to Driftrock Ltd and our job opportunities. We will store your data for a year before deleting all individually identifiable information. If you wish data to be deleted sooner, respond to this email requesting the deletion of your data".

items.content:
Full-stack Developer with Front-end Focus

Location: Remote Singapore
Role and job type: Full-time

Job Description

We are looking for a Full-stack developer who has a strong interest in blockchain technology,
open-source, and in designing the best user experience. You can work autonomously, have a
strong integrity and are up for the challenge to build a more efficient future.

You will join the Request Network Foundation team which is part of the YCombinator network.
We share strong values and have been working together for several years.

Responsibilities

  • Develop Request Network apps, libraries, and websites
  • Help educating our community about how to build on Request
  • Contribute to a decentralized payment protocol built on the blockchain

Qualifications

  • Passionate about creating and releasing projects, as well as learning new languages
  • Be able to identify relations between parts of complex projects
  • Be able to demonstrate a deep understanding of the blockchain architecture
  • Hold a Master’s in computer science or an equivalent field (STEM)
  • Proven analytical and proactive problem solving skills
  • Experience with modern web development (responsive design with HTML/CSS, ES6, React/
    Angular/Node.js, etc.). Knowledge of web3.js library is a plus
  • Optional: You have the skills to recreate the Rick and Morty Portal Gun and an opinion on how
    to avoid being trapped into one of the Black Mirror scenarios of the future

Singapore for six months, one of the major European capitals afterwards.
Part-time remote work possible after a while.

Salary range

Competitive

Lead Front-end Engineer (Core Team Member)

Job Description

You’re the one who makes Checkbook Inc. simple, beautiful, and easy to use. We’re looking for someone with both design and engineering skills and a keen eye for all aspects of a user’s experience. You should be able to design what you think up - you’ll be responsible for all forward facing pieces of Checkbook Inc: our developer portal, user onboarding process, end-user authentication flow, and documentation. Oh yes - our website too.

Our ideal candidate will be: self-motivated, eat, sleep and breathe JS libraries, dream in CSS and read/write in HTML. We’re mostly a Python shop so familiarity with Python or willingness to learn. Will have knowledge of server side process, while still being conscious of the user facing side. Experience in SEO is a plus.

items.content:
Senior Front End Developer - Vue.js

Company: CipherHealth, Inc
Location: Remote
Job type: Full-time
Skills:
  • Ruby
  • Ruby on Rails
  • Vue.js

    • Company description

    Since CipherHealth’s founding in 2009, we have grown to support hundreds of hospitals across the US with a singular mission: save and improve life. We're fortunate to live in a time where incentives are becoming better aligned. Healthcare providers care more and more about longer term patient-outcomes, and we have a portfolio of solutions that meet a lot of their needs. CipherHealth's platform includes three core components, each of which supports several modules. It's big. It's complicated. It's awesome. And most importantly, it works. Our technology helps people avoid hospital admissions, streamlines workflow and improves medication adherence. We have tons of case studies to back this up.



    We are building a company where you, the intrepid job seeker, can hopefully find an alignment in purpose, career growth and community. Your work here will matter. It will help save lives.

    Job description

    CipherHealth is looking for a developer to help us drive towards a bright new future in a unified front-end framework powered by Vue.js. The ideal candidate will be as comfortable writing vanilla Javascript as they are working with Vue.js. They will have at least some experience working as a full-stack developer (e.g., writing your own APIs for the front-end) and a strong predilection towards the front-end: creating great UI, great UX, reusable components, and a unified, beautiful app.

    What You’ll be Doing:

    • Redesigning older areas of the application to leverage our new front end framework.. or maybe
    • Building brand new areas for the application and working on new products
    • Advancing our front-end framework to support a wide variety of standardized components
    • Building and testing user-facing code using tools like Vue.js, Vuex, and Webpack
    • Building features that create excellent user experiences
    • Working with engineers, designers, product managers and senior leadership

    What We’re Looking For:

    • Expert knowledge of Vue.js and associated frameworks
    • Proven ability to implement mocks/comps and/or manage design independently
    • Proficiency or willingness to learn Rails/Ruby
    • Knowledge of core computer science foundations
    • Excited about writing clean code, evaluating technologies to meet the needs of clients
    Apply now!

items.content:
We are a high growth, well funded start-up business providing a hardware / software solution to Airbnb hosts, vacation rental professionals and serviced apartments to enable them to monetise their guests through on-demand services and bring an “in-property” revenue stream to the short stay market. We are based in Blackfriars, London and are opening a sales office in the US in August to continue our rapid growth in North America.

We have built our products using the latest technologies to create fast, scalable and accessible products that work on any device and deliver fantastic consumer experiences.

Our customer dashboard/portal and the checkout of our website are built in React. We are looking for someone to takeover and lead the front end (and associated back end elements) from our CTO as this area of the business now requires its own team. The successful candidate will immediately help grow the team by helping recruit a second developer to work alongside them.

The web portal is a key part of our offering and we expect this role to become more important within the business as we scale. There are plenty of opportunities to put your own stamp on the project.

REQUIREMENTS:

A minimum of two years working with React

Practical experience with:
- ES6
- GraphQL
- Relay
- Mysql
- GIT, issue tracking and code management
- Code testing in Javascript using Jest or similar
- Npm, webpack, gulp etc.

Useful to have:
- Node.js
- PHP/other OOP languages
- Amazon EC2 servers

We are looking for someone to start as soon as possible. The interview process will involve:

- A phone call with our CTO to discuss the company, your background and the role
- A tech test (which can be done remotely and will take approx 1.5-2 hours)
- A face-to-face interview (at our Blackfriars office) with our existing lead dev and a member of senior management

This role is for an in-house position working at the Blackfriars office (initially 5 days a week while you get familiar with our platform etc but later we are flexible to dropping this to 4 days in house and 1 day remote).

We look forward to hearing from you...

Please send a CV and we'll get back to you as soon as we can.

Thanks for looking!

items.content:
Front End Web / Application Developer (remote)

Location: Remote United Kingdom
Role and job type: Engineering Full-time

Job Description

We’re a no nonsense dev firm. We’re not trying to ICO and we don’t need to raise money. We work directly with a client to take a proof-of-concept to a production-grade software. We work with several different startups and a VC firm to build out a variety of blockchain-based systems.

We are searching for an experienced web and application developer to join our front end development team. This work can be done remotely.

In this position, you will have the freedom to program modern layouts, streamlined user interfaces, and cutting-edge web designs for the applications and websites we build for our clients. As a company, we are obsessed with quality. It is critical you have an eye for detail in this position.

This position will require roughly 50 hours a week on a regular work schedule. If you fit into the company culture than our commitment to you is this: A long-term relationship where you have room to grow and improve your skills. As a startup, we are interested in sharing our success with our employees and helping you achieve your professional goals.

The Ideal Candidate:
We’re looking for someone that is skilled at using JavaScript and JavaScript libraries, and has mastery over HTML5, CSS, and other front end tools, and can prove this competency through a portfolio of completed work.

  • Oversee the implementation of finished designs and turn them into functional products
  • Skillful at estimating project timelines and providing reasonable deadlines
  • Knowledgeable about UI/UX from an implementation perspective
  • Keeps up with new standards and trends in web development
  • Mindful of backward compatibility with older browsers and operating systems
  • Works well with a team of other hardcore developers
  • Is timely and able to dedicate his/her attention to this position

Skills and Experience:
3 years experience as a front end developer in a structured capacity (company employment)
A striking portfolio of work from past jobs or freelance work

Things We Like:

  • University education in computer science, informatics or design
  • An understanding of blockchain and cryptocurrency

If you’re interested in a position that offers autonomy, creative freedom, and prioritizes quality over quantity, then please send your 1) resume, 2) a portfolio with links to your previous work

We prefer candidates who are in the UK–we like to meet once a month to talk about work over board games. :-)
Paid in cash or crypto, your choice.

Salary range

28k - 40k

items.content:
Location: Lisbon office

Streamhub is a London based video analytics startup with a worldwide customer base. We provide big data analytics reporting tools for media companies helping them target, grow and monetise loyal video audiences.
Our dashboard simplifies complex data insights offering a range of visualisations that helps discover key patterns and trends. It’s all about giving a great user experience and designing new ways to express information.

We are looking to strengthen our remote team with an experienced frontend developer that loves analytics/data visualisation.

Role and responsibility

This is a remote role where you will join a talented fast-paced team to work on deliverables every week;
1. Develop various features, fix bugs, refactor the frontend of our analytics app written in Angular 1.4, which consumes REST APIs and generates reports laid over customizable dashboard.
2. Work on angular (latests) refactoring of our FE app from Angular 1 into Angular 5.

Required Skills

1. Rock solid proficiency (3 years+) in javascript (ES5 and ES6), angular.js, angular 2 and above
2. Proficient in English speaking and writing
3. Must have at least 5 years of professional experience in production-level software
development

Bonus point:

1. Highcharts, D3.js, dataviz library
2. PDFKit
3. Auth0
4. TDD, Integration tests, Selenium, mocha, jasmine

Package

● Full time contractor with a view to become Full time employee if successful
● Flexible working hours as long as you can overlap 5 working hours with our London working hours (9am - 6pm GMT), on the days you work

Closing date: 4 Sep 2018

items.content:
We are seeking a talented, self-motivated and ethically minded web developer to join our positive team. You will play a key role in the development of client websites and internal projects such as our website carbon calculator, helping us to lead our industry in creating low carbon, high performance, accessible websites that create positive impact online.

This is a full time semi-remote role in an open and relaxed environment in which you will split your time between working from home, our office near Piccadilly in London and meeting clients at their offices in and around London.

If you have a passion for problem solving, web development and sustainability, this is a chance to join a supportive team and help us to not only achieve our clients goals but also to achieve our mission of using business to help create a sustainable and equitable world.

Preferred experience:

  • Experience in PHP, HTML, CSS and JS development, ideally with considerable experience working with complex WordPress projects
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as React is an advantage
  • Familiarity with automated deployment systems
  • Experience of planning and monitoring software delivery and testing
  • Experience developing accessible web solutions
  • Experience with version control systems
  • Experience integrating third-party APIs
  • Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical people
  • Understanding of internal and external business requirements
  • Solid understanding of technical on-site SEO
  • Solid understanding of web security
  • Experience with SASS/LESS
  • Familiarity with DNS configurations, CDNs and SSL
  • Experience of working remotely & autonomously

Benefits:

  • Flexible working
  • Rewards for using renewable energy at home
  • Team Days
  • Pension
  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Free access to London’s Santander bikes
  • Paid travelling for events in Europe
  • Discounts and invitations to events and facilities at Somerset House

items.content:
Location: Old Street, London N1

Start Date: ASAP

Salary: depending on experience and skill level

WHO ARE DRIFTROCK?

Driftrock was started with the aim of making advertising through social channels better. There’s no excuse for being chased around the internet by images of products you’ve already bought. It’s irritating for the end user and counterproductive for the company attempting to sell their products or services. Using our tooling marketers can refine their targeting such that the ads are only shown to people who have shown genuine interest.

WORKING AT DRIFTROCK

Driftrock’s tooling provides our users with a way to receive, transform, track and optimise leads from social channels. Currently these tools look and feel very separate so we’re in the process of bringing them together, with the view to having Driftrock be more of a platform than a set of tools. Other problems we’re solving, and are looking to solve in the near future, include:

* How to securely and safely handle personally identifying information;
* How to enrich incoming data with information that will help our users decide on the best next steps for their leads;
* What reports to provide to our users such that they can see if their efforts are resulting in quality leads and what they can do to improve.

The technology is a mixture of Ruby, Elixir and React applications hosted on Kubernetes and Google Cloud. We make use of Redis and Postgres for data storage and RabbitMQ for event processing.

You will be expected to:

* Build RESTful APIs, event-based systems and front-end applications;
* Work with well-known public APIs like Facebook and LinkedIn;
* Design and improve user experience;
* Support production systems;
* Manage cloud infrastructure.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We’re a small team of 15 people at Driftrock but we’re growing. Our product development team is 7 people with 6 developers and 1 CTO, this means that anyone we bring in can have a huge impact on the culture and practices of the team.

We believe in continuous improvement and we are constantly refining and improving how we work and communicate. One of the ways we do this is by performing fortnightly retrospectives, which are often run by different team members.

Currently we make use of daily standups and weekly prioritisation meetings to ensure we're pulling in the same direction and maintaining our focus of delivering value to our end users early and often.

ABOUT YOU

* You should be keen to learn and improve technical, product and personal skills;
* You want to be involved in crafting products whilst building on the culture and process of the product team;
* You are happy working in a small team, collaborating closely with other engineers as well as our product and sales teams;
* You can provide new and diverse viewpoints for our technical and product discussions;
* You are interested in agile practices such as continuous delivery, TDD, pair programming, code reviews and retrospectives;
* You are keen to ensure there is a high standard of quality and security in the software we produce as a team;
* You are interested in mentoring and coach other team members;
* You have had some exposure to Ruby, Elixir or Javascript (we do not expect you to have experience in all of those languages);
* You have the right to work in the UK.

WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?

The interview process has some flexibility but is primarily made up of the following stages:

* An initial phone conversation with an engineer;
* A take home technical test/coding challenge;
* Followed by an on-site pairing interview, where we'll build on your code challenge solution. We then do an informal problem solving task and we finish up with an informal chat with the rest of the team.

We try our hardest to reduce the amount of stress involved in the process, we’re not trying to catch you out with trick questions and if at any point (even on the take home test) you have any questions for us we encourage you to ask them.

BENEFITS

* You will work with passionate and smart people, in an environment where we firmly believe in sharing knowledge;
* You will be an integral part of a growing and innovative tech startup;
* You can be enrolled to the Company’s pension scheme;
* The company atmosphere is social and friendly;
* You will be part of fun monthly team events.

We will not be considering any recruitment agencies for this role.

"By applying for this job you hereby give us permission to store your data on our secure applicant tracking system and to contact you with regards to Driftrock Ltd and our job opportunities. We will store your data for a year before deleting all individually identifiable information. If you wish data to be deleted sooner, respond to this email requesting the deletion of your data".
